channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Nelson Mandela Road - flytipping and litter, 21st September
item.description:
Items of wood and fly tipping dumped along the road. Needs a deep clean. Litter is everywhere and the council are neglecting this area. Email sent to MP due to lack of action from RBG

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nelson Mandela Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown shrubs filled with Litter, 21st September
item.description:
At the end of the footpath at Ivor grove, there has been overgrown vegetation for at least two months. Because of that, people use this for littering as well. Please remove the weeds and pick up the litter

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Ivor Grove, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter / Entrance to Kelsey Park, Wickham Rd., 21st September
item.description:
Location: Area fenced off with temporary railings immediately to the left of the entrance to Kelsey Park (Café), Wickham Road. FMS directed me to Parks rather than Street Cleaning. Once upon a time this area was a reasonably attractive plant/shrub bed, this has been removed and now the area is cordoned off with temporary railings. A large amount of litter has accumulated within and around these railings and is very unsightly - please can you attend and clear all the litter, it would be good to get an explanation as to what is happening with this area and why it’s fenced off. I’m sharing a what3words address to help you find this specific location. Tap to see exactly where it is: ///yoga.ocean.oasis https://w3w.co/yoga.ocean.oasis

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wickham Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A HMO at 36 Holtwhites Hill does not have sufficient bins and because they are overflowing the bins do not get emptied. Leading this week for the green bin being emptied of bags and left on the pavement., 21st September
item.description:
Rubbish build up over the last month leading to foxes and rats eating out daily and spreading the rubbish/food up and down Holtwhites Hill. There are both infant, junior and secondary school students walking pass daily and is a hazard both on health grounds and accident hazard

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Holtwhite's Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4 dead saplings by their tree stakes in the council-owned green space (former Cyphers Cricket Ground) in Kings Hall Rd, by the jct with Bailes Place., 21st September
item.description:
4 dead saplings by their tree stakes in the council-owned green space (former Cyphers Cricket Ground) in Kings Hall Rd, by the jct with Bailes Place. Reported here under shrub beds as there is no menu selection for Park trees. Please also provide some name signs at either end of this open space to give it a name and identify it's ownership by LBB.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Hall Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: House electricity wire through top of the tree, 21st September
item.description:
Danger to electricity wire to the house from branches of the tree. Please can consider the top of the tree for pruning below the wire. There is also uplift of the kerb from the roots of the tree. Can you consider these issues and check safety for us?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Lime Grove, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
